intro: Justicia pectoralis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf flame flower, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of the Americas. It features showy, tubular flowers that are typically red or orange, arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are broad and slightly hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This species is often cultivated for its vibrant blooms and is used in landscaping and as a cut flower.
